Ann,
 
All I did was make a comment, was that so wrong?  I did it for  ever=
yone 
especially asking that he take it private and not post it in this  pu=
blic forum.  
And for that I deserve to be bashed and receive a  threatenin=
g letter.  Would 
you like to see a copy of this letter as to how  he threa=
tened me and calling 
me names?
And you yourself never mention that he shou=
ld apologize to me either.   Have 
I ever done anything to offend you?  Unf=
ortunately these are the type  of 
people we are dealing with and again I w=
ill say IT SHOULD HAVE BEEN DONE IN A  
PRIVET EMAIL.  Is that so much to a=
sk?
 
Now after that has been said I would like to wish you luck with your =
 
research on your new box.
 
Jeff
 
In a message dated 2/11/2008 9:57:46 A=
.M. Central Standard Time,  
lisby@... writes:

 
 
 
Respectfull=
y, it was still not the correct one. Bruce should have been  asked 
to apol=
ogize and Laura should have taken ownership of her comment and  
apologized=
, too. (She later chose to apologize for using the word "balls,"  which 
wa=
s so very clearly not at all the issue.) Instead, Bruce was cut off so  tha=
t 
he couldn't apologize. You can argue semantics with me all day, but  sus=
pension 
of posting rights and banning are *effectively* the same thing. No=
  incoming 
communication. <WBR>And I know that I can leave if I don't like=
  it, but I can 
continue to post if I am a good girl.


And there it remai=
ns, and shall, I think.


Ann


On Feb 11, 2008, at 10:28 AM, Frank Ratka w=
rote:



 
 



Just  and FYI on the conflict of interest idea. The decisio=
n to take any 
action  did not even come up until after Bruce's post to Jef=
f. The action that was 
 taken was not unilateral, meaning it wasn't just L=
aura's  decision.

Regards,

Frank R.
